definition: to take risks/to run risks
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
danger/dangerous/rugged
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
variant of 鋌而走險|铤而走险[ting3 er2 zou3 xian3]

sentences.english: In this case, they had to take risks, engage in Private Salt production.
sentences.chinese: 在此情况下，他们只好铤而走险，从事私盐生产。

sentences.english: Why do some journalists and media dare to take a risk?
sentences.chinese: 少数记者和新闻媒体为何铤而走险？

sentences.english: So many seekers risk, and some lose, their lives in pursuit of the Miami dream.
sentences.chinese: 许多迈阿密寻梦者铤而走险，有人甚至成了亡灵。

sentences.english: Of Li Heping risk danger in desperation stimulate will conspiratorial have one's way.
sentences.chinese: 李和平铤而走险的激将阴谋得逞了。

definition: variant of 鋌而走險|铤而走险[ting3 er2 zou3 xian3]
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
dirty trick
to fight with all one has
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
to submit/to give in
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
to set a trap
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to scam/to set a trap/to set up a scheme to defraud people
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
to kill sb/to murder
gone forever (idiom)
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
